message: Discussion on this mailing list post: http://groups.google.com/group/pythonkc/browse_thread/thread/1aff7b124a3af4b5
Ah yes, cross post. Good call.
I think working on pythonkc.com is a no brainer.  Pygame sounds like a blast as well.
I bet most of the stuff we work on will just be random and whatever somebody decides to bring in that day.  I know I have a few things I wouldn't mind some collaboration / code review on.
I do like the idea of building a website for a charity.  Somebody had brought that up in our first meeting.  I imagine that would take a bit more planning though.

LOVE the idea of  coding for charity! I've got a few ideas of places we can do that for..I have a feeling like having a ton of people working on pythonkc.com might get messy? Getting everyone setup would take-up half the time already. I like the idea

Doh! I like the idea of everyone coming to the hack day with projects or things they want to work on and then finding mentors or collaborators. Might be a nice idea for everyone to post ahead of time what they are going to work on and see who bites???
I'm just getting into one for charity myself. It's not a big project, so it would be something cool to work on at a hack-day, but maybe get some visual design input on as well.
Yeah, I think we'd probably want to put a team of 3 -4 on the website.  Then have everybody else just self-organize what they want to work on
